Package application.controllers

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BookingController
    Purpose: Display Booking information, and manipulate Booking objects Description: Contains all methods manipulating bookings, and sets up the views primarily governed with booking tables and manipulation (Booking (for displaying information about a particular booking), Bookings (for displaying a table of all bookings a Customer has made), BookingSeats (for displaying a seat plan a Customer can choose their booking seats from), and Screening (for displaying an employee a seat plan for a screening, and enabling the employee to delete the screening)).
    CustomerController
    Purpose: Control basic Customer functionality.
    EmployeeController
    Purpose: Control basic Employee functionality.
    FilmController
    Purpose: Display Film and Screening information, and and manipulate Film and Screening objects Description: Contains all methods manipulating films and screenings, and sets up the views primarily governed with film and screening tables and manipulation (FilmEmployee and FilmCustomer (displaying information about a given film), NewFilm (for adding new films), NewScreening (for adding new screenings), NewBooking (for displaying a screenings table and choosing one for a new booking), and ScreeningsCustomer and ScreeningsEmployee (for displaying a list of screenings for a given film)).
    LoginController
    Purpose: Control logging in to the program, and for setting up a User and their environment Description: Checks the user's username and password (via the Login view) and enables creation of Customer's (via the Registration view).
    MainController
    Purpose: Parent class for all Controllers, governs transitions and globally available functionality such as logging out.
    NavbarController
    Purpose: Enable the Employee to export information outside the program.
    UserController
    Purpose: Sets up and controls the Dashboard views for an Employee and for a Customer Description: Depending on the mode in which it is set, initialises either the Customer's or the Employee's dashboard, with a table of films and buttons to the other parts of the program.
